alert.note: Alert for Morris (New Jersey) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly (New Jersey, Delaware, Southeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued September 09 at 3:47PM EDT until September 09 at 4:30PM EDT by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: The National Weather Service in Mount Holly NJ has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Southeastern Morris County in northern New Jersey... * Until 430 PM EDT. * At 347 PM EDT, a severe thunderstorm was located over East Hanover, or near Caldwell, moving north at 10 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Minor damage to vehicles is possible. Wind damage to roofs, siding, trees, and power lines is possible. * Locations impacted include... Madison, Florham Park, East Hanover, Lincoln Park, Kinnelon, Chatham, Boonton, Butler, Mountain Lakes, Riverdale, Parsippany, Pequannock Township and Hanover Township. This includes the following highways... Interstate 80 in New Jersey between mile markers 43 and 48. Interstate 287 in New Jersey between mile markers 40 and 54. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. In addition to large hail and damaging winds, frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Move indoors immediately. Remember, if you can hear thunder, you are close enough to be struck by lightning. Torrential rainfall is occurring with this storm, and may lead to flash flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
